elements.title: Zapad 2009 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Russian and Belarussian military exercise Zapad 2009 (pictured) involved nuclear-capable ballistic missiles?

elements.title: Robyn Gigl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Robyn Gigl novel By Way of Sorrow, which features a transgender lawyer as the protagonist, was described as "quietly groundbreaking" by The New York Times?

elements.title: 2024 heat wave in Southeast Asia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that due to a 2024 heat wave in Southeast Asia, heat indices in the Philippines rose to dangerous levels, as high as 51 °C (124 °F)?

elements.title: Hal Malchow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hal Malchow consulted for every Democratic presidential nominee from 1988 through 2004?

elements.title: Rosal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before its inhabitants were evicted, Rosal was the largest of 49 townships in Strathnaver?

elements.title: Mohammad Saifullah Ozaki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mohammad Saifullah Ozaki, an academic in Japan born to a Hindu family in Bangladesh, became a leader in the Islamic State?

elements.title: floods across New York City in September 2023 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that floods across New York City in September 2023 allowed a sea lion to escape her enclosure at the Central Park Zoo?

elements.title: Dedie Rachim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dedie Rachim was the first active member of the Corruption Eradication Commission to be elected to public office?

elements.title: a boot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a boot is the only monument in the United States dedicated to the traitor Benedict Arnold because it "was the only part of Arnold not to later turn traitor"?
